definitions.text: the period of time that is happening now; any continuous stretch of time including the moment of speech
examples: that is enough for the present
he lives in the present with no thought of tomorrow
his tie was a present from his wife

definitions.text: a verb tense that expresses actions or states at the time of speaking
give an exhibition of to an interested audience
examples: She shows her dogs frequently
We will demo the new software in Washington

definitions.text: bring forward and present to the mind
examples: We presented the arguments to him
We cannot represent this knowledge to our formal reason

definitions.text: perform (a play), especially on a stage
examples: we are going to stage `Othello'
This poses an interesting question

definitions.text: give, especially as an honor or reward
examples: bestow honors and prizes at graduation

definitions.text: give as a present; make a gift of
examples: What will you give her for her birthday?
The commencement speaker presented a forceful speech that impressed the students

definitions.text: cause to come to know personally
examples: permit me to acquaint you with my son
introduce the new neighbors to the community

definitions.text: represent abstractly, for example in a painting, drawing, or sculpture
examples: The father is portrayed as a good-looking man in this painting

definitions.text: present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize
examples: We confronted him with the evidence
He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions
An enormous dilemma faces us

definitions.text: formally present a debutante, a representative of a country, etc.
recognize with a gesture prescribed by a military regulation; assume a prescribed position
examples: When the officers show up, the soldiers have to salute

definitions.text: temporal sense; intermediate between past and future; now existing or happening or in consideration
examples: the present leader
articles for present use
the present topic
the present system
present observations

definitions.text: being or existing in a specified place
examples: the murderer is present in this room
present at the wedding
present at the creation
